text: so so thrilled to have with me today
our latest cookbook clean slate this is
150 recipes delicious nutritious easy to
make really really great makes a
wonderful gift year round but especially
after the big holiday push in December
so this is great one to give to your
friends loved ones coworkers we're going
to be making the cover salad today it's
a roasted salmon with ruby red
grapefruit and avocado delicious let's
get started
I have two skinless fillets of wild
salmon they're about 5 ounces each
drizzle it with about a tablespoon of
olive oil and season with salt and
pepper sprinkle this with one sliced
scallion this is going to add a really
nice sort of a glioma note while it
roasts so this is going to bake at 375
for about 10 minutes just until it's
cooked through my salmon has come out
and I've let it rest just slightly so
it's not blazing blazing hot all we need
to do is sort of gently flake it with a
fork break it into pretty large pieces
here smells amazing ok it looks great
let's get started on our ruby red
grapefruit here remove the pith so the
ruby red grapefruit has a lot more
nutrients than just the plain white
flesh the really rich in antioxidants
vitamin C super hydrating very
refreshing oh this smells amazing
alright so now you can either make
cross-sections or you can supreme' do
just cutting out each individual segment
of fruit so I grew up always eating
grapefruit with a little pinch of salt
my friends would eat it with sugar but I
always loved the salt and the salt
brings out the sweetness so make sure
after you remove all of these segments
to not discard the membrane here lots
and lots of juice in that I'm going to
just squeeze it over the entire salad
not to be missed
ok so save the membrane for juicing and
now we'll work on our avocado
one of my favorite ingredients can
probably tell it's in almost every video
on eat clean so take out the pit and if
you see any discoloration just use a
small spoon to remove perfect now peel
the skin away like an orange I always
like to peel it because there's a really
really beneficial antioxidants right
underneath the layer of the skin the
sort of darker green bit and you lose
that if you use a spoon to scoop it out
of the shell
this is also a really great way to get
nice tidy slices so now just slice these
you can either go lengthwise or
crosswise whichever you prefer
okay so let's assemble start with our
flaked salmon which smells amazing
already so just spread the salmon sort
of along the bottom of a platter now top
with ruby red grape fruits very very
colorful salad here okay add the
avocados so this is one of those really
lovely composed salads you definitely
don't want to shake this up toss it too
much that way all the pieces stay nice
and fresh and whole and wonderful top it
with about two cups of tender greens
have a nice mixture of baby greens here
sunflower sprouts or other sprouts are
really incredible if you happen to find
them now for convenience sake if you're
still trying to get seafood into your
diet don't have time to cook salmon
canned sardines would be a really
excellent substitution here last little
pea tendril now let's season with salt
and pepper and we have one more scallion
thinly sliced adds a nice bit of
freshness now remember our membrane give
it a good squeeze all right to finish
drizzle with a little bit of olive oil
here and then some fresh lime juice we
have two different types of citrus going
on here the grapefruit tends to be
sweeter the lime really adds a nice
acidity wake the whole thing up also
limes go so great with avocados who can
resist
can't wait to try mmm so so good so
simple to prepare this would be a great
weeknight meal I can't wait for you to
eat clean with clean slate
